Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/2/2025, Youth A ran away from the facility after an incident
occurred between herself and Staff 1. Staff 1 entered Youth A's
room and punched Youth A on her left side. The punch was
described as a jab. Youth A does have a bruise on her left
hip/stomach area. Youth A is in fear of Staff 1. Youth A was not
seen by any medical personnel.
Investigation Administrator 2 was interviewed via phone on 8/4/2025. She
reported Staff 1 is off the schedule until told that Staff 1 could
return to work. She reported Youth A is at the facility and doing
well but Supervisor 1 is off work until tomorrow.
Administrator 1, Administrator 2, and Administrator 3 were
interviewed face-to-face at the facility with MDHHS Worker 1
on 8/5/2025. They reported reviewing the video footage from the
day of the incident and finding Staff 1 did enter Youth A’s room
after the reported time frame and never witnessed Youth A acting
fearful of Staff 1. They reported the footage shows interactions
between Youth A (Staff 1 fixes the back of Youth A’s dress after
Youth A approaches Staff 1) and all staff involved reported Youth
A was asking to speak to Staff 1 alone later in the shift. They
reported never noticing a bruise or being told of a bruise by Youth
A. There were no witnesses to the alleged hitting of Youth A by
Staff 1 and Staff 1 has a history of being very calm and never
responding to assaults by youth with violence. They reported
when Youth A returned to the facility, Administrator 2 reported
Youth A smelled like liquor and Youth A had money on Youth A’s
person. Administrator 2 indicated this was correct about Youth A
smelling of alcohol. They also reported having copies of notes
Youth A and Youth B were writing during the afternoon. The notes
outlined Youth A wanting Youth B to go with Youth A and get
drugs and alcohol. At this time, Youth A is reported to have gone
2

upstairs saying it was cold, changing clothing to street clothes.
Staff 5 is reported to have not noticed the change of clothing and
both Youth A and Youth B “ran out of the door”. Youth A and
Youth B split up when finding themselves being followed by staff
and Staff 3 caught up with Youth B right away and returned Youth
B to the facility. Administrator 1 reported hearing the call from Law
Enforcement to the facility after finding Youth A at the Hotel and
hearing Youth A screaming that she could not return to the facility
because of her fear of what Staff 1 would do to her. They reported
the safety plan will involve Staff 1 never being off camera view
and not working with Youth A. Staff 1 is to keep her distance from
Youth A at all times.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with
MDHHS Worker 1 on 8/5/2025. Youth A reported understanding
why she was being interviewed and stated it started at Walmart
earlier in the day. Youth A reported once back at the facility, Staff
1 came into Youth A’s bedroom and told Youth A, “I know you
didn’t hear me say that” about what Youth A alleged Staff 1 said to
Youth B at Walmart. Youth A alleged Staff 1 told Youth B “bald
headed ass hoe shut your ass up” (see the second section of this
report). Youth A reported telling Staff 1 that Youth A was going to
write a grievance against Staff 1 and Staff 1 responded by
“jabbing” Youth A in the side. Youth A reported being upset the
rest of the day and left the facility later without her shoes because
she was upset. Youth A reported finding a “girl” on the road who
took Youth A to a hotel lobby and helped by calling 911. After
telling Law Enforcement that Youth A had come from a group
home they escorted Youth A back to the facility. Youth A was
asked for more details about the situation and reported nothing
like this has taken place at the facility before and the argument
between Youth B and Staff 1 triggered Youth A. Youth A changed
the time of the alleged incident of Staff 1 jabbing Youth A from
around 1:15 pm to the time that was observed on the video
footage of 2:24 pm. Youth A added Staff 1 asked for body oil
which Youth A provided to Staff 1 and never said anything when
jabbing Youth A. Youth A reported feeling silly about making a big
thing of something so small. When asked why Youth A didn’t say
anything when it happened, Youth A reported she was scared it
would happen again because of her past experiences at other
places. Youth A then reported not knowing why she didn’t say
something at the time and that she felt safe around Staff 1. Youth
A was asked about screaming at the hotel and reported she didn’t
want to go back to the facility but wanted to cooperate with the
police. Youth A was asked about going outside with Staff 1 to talk
after the alleged jabbing and Youth A reported it was because
3

Youth A wanted to talk about the other youth in the program,
especially the “argument” with Youth B. Youth A was unable to
recall what was said between herself and Staff 1 on the porch.
Youth A was asked about the contact she appeared to have with
Staff 1 following the jabbing incident and being fearful of Staff 1
and Youth A reported trying to keep things cordial between them
because she was fearful it would happen again. Youth A admitted
to writing the notes about drugs and alcohol but denied using any
substances when AWOL.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with
MDHHS Worker 1 on 8/5/2025. Staff 1 reported working the day
and time of the incident and only went into Youth A’s room
(normally doesn’t go into a youth’s room) to get body oil for
another youth. She reported getting the oil and returning back
downstairs to give the oil to Youth C. Staff 1 reported they went to
the YMCA and then back to the facility without incident. Staff 1
reported everyone was having a good time back at the facility
before Staff 1 obtained the oil from Youth A’s room. Staff 1 was
asked about Youth A wanting to speak to Staff 1 alone and
reported Youth A wanted Staff 1 to hook Youth A up with Staff 1’s
18-year-old son. Youth A had asked Staff 1 to have Staff 1’s son
look Youth A up on TikTok and gave Staff 1 a paper with Youth
A’s information. Staff 1 admitted to taking the paper but had no
plan to give it to her son. Staff 1 reported Youth A wanted to talk
again but left because her shift was over and she didn’t see Youth
A. Staff 1 reported never observing a bruise on Youth A and never
hitting Youth A .
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone with MDHHS Worker 1 on
8/6/2025. Regarding the allegation of Staff 1 hitting Youth A, Staff
2 reported first hearing about this allegation of Staff 1 hitting Youth
A when Staff 2 came to the facility because Youth A had Law
Enforcement contacted, and Staff 2 was the on-call worker at the
time. Staff 2 reported overhearing Youth A tell Law Enforcement
of Staff 1 hitting Youth A. Staff 2 reported never hearing Youth A
talk about a bruise prior to what she overheard the day Law
Enforcement brought Youth A back from AWOL. She reported
Youth A is “very open and if hurt or this really happened, Youth A
would be the first to tell other staff”.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone with MDHHS Worker 1 on
8/6/2025. Staff 3 reported speaking to Youth A when getting to
work at 4:00 pm because Youth A had requested to speak to Staff
3. Youth A did not mention anything about a physical altercation
(hit by Staff 1) but did say Youth A felt intimidated by Staff 1.
4

Youth A informed Staff 3 it was because of the alleged yelling at
Walmart involving Youth B and Staff 1. Staff 3 reported Youth A
never said anything about being hit by Staff 1 until after being
brought back to the facility by Law Enforcement. Staff 3 reported
prior to Staff 1 leaving for the day, Youth A kept asking to speak to
Staff 1 alone and became very upset when Staff 1 left for the day
without speaking to Youth A. Staff 3 was asked about any
knowledge of a bruise on Youth A’s hip and Staff 3 reported three
days prior to the day of the Walmart incident, Youth A informed
Staff 3 that Youth A had hit Youth A’s hip on a door or bed
causing a bruise. Youth A did not show Staff 3 the bruise. Staff 3
reported working with Staff 1 and finding that Staff 1 doesn’t curse
and shows no signs of having a temper.
Guardian was interviewed via phone with MDHHS Worker 1
on 8/6/2025. He reported being informed by the facility about the
allegations and speaking with Youth A after the AWOL of Youth A.
He reported asking why Youth A went AWOL and having Youth A
inform him that Staff 1 hit Youth A and Youth A wanted to get out
of the program. He reported speaking to Youth A prior to Youth A
going AWOL and Youth A never mentioned anything about being
hit and informed Guardian that things were going well. Youth A’s
reply to Guardian was, “don’t know why I didn’t tell you”. Guardian
shared a belief that Youth A made up the hitting story to cover up
for Youth A’s AWOL actions and Youth A tends to engage in this
deceptive behavior to avoid consequences. Guardian reported the
facility does a great job of informing him of any situations that
occur.
Youth B was interviewed on 8/5/25 by MDHHS Worker 1 at the
facility and the following is the note from that interview.
Youth B has been living in the home for about a month and a half.
Youth B stated she does feel safe in the home and mentioned
Staff 1 as one of her favorite staff. Youth B was asked if she was
aware of the injury on Youth A. Youth A told Youth B on Sunday,
08/03/2025 that Staff 1 hit her the day before in her
bedroom. Youth B does not think this is true. Youth B stated Staff
1 would not risk her job, and Youth B has never seen Staff 1 act in
this type of way. Staff 1 is calm with them when they are acting
out. Youth B stated a couple days ago Youth A showed Staff 4
and herself a bruise on her side. Youth A said she got it from
hitting her hip on the door handle. Youth B thinks it was her left
side. Youth B gets enough food and Youth B denied any physical
discipline.
5

Youth C was interviewed on 8/5/25 by MDHHS Worker 1 at the
facility and the following is the note from that interview.
Youth C was asked if she knew about the bruise on Youth
A. Youth C stated Youth A told her on Sunday 08/03/2025, Staff 1
came into her room on Saturday and told her not to tell anyone
what she said at Walmart, and Staff 1 made the bruise on her side
by jabbing her. Youth C stated she already knew Youth A was
lying because Staff 1 did not say anything at Walmart. Youth C
stated Staff 1 would not hit anyone and risk her job, and Youth A
was lying. Youth C denied any physical discipline in the home and
gets enough food. Youth A is obsessed with Youth B, and if Youth
B is lying then Youth A will lie. If Youth B is telling the truth, then
Youth A will tell the truth. Youth C stated that over the weekend,
Youth A and Youth B did run away from home. When Youth A was
caught and brought home by the police, Youth A had alcohol in
her cup. Youth A said she got it from the girl at the hotel. Youth A
had it on Sunday at church and offered Youth C some in a
cup. Youth C took it but did not drink it. Youth A does not have
alcohol anymore in the house.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone with MDHHS Worker
1 on 8/13/2025. He reported finding out about the allegations
when Youth A was returned to the facility by Law Enforcement. He
described Youth A as “emotionally hysterical”, claiming Staff 1 had
“jabbed” Youth A in her side. He reported not being close enough
to smell alcohol on Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported staff have
found at least 10 bottles of hand sanitizer in Youth A’s bedroom
and believed Youth A has been sneaking out to get hand sanitizer
to drink for the alcohol. He reported Youth A was confronted but
denied everything about the hand sanitizer. Supervisor 1 reported
the safety plan for Youth A is that Youth A is not allowed to carry
water bottles (putting hand sanitizer in water bottles) and Youth
A’s clothing will be searched after each outing.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone with MDHHS Worker 1 on
8/13/2025. She reported having no knowledge of the allegations of
Staff 1 jabbing Youth A in the hip. She reported being told by
Youth A earlier in the week that Youth A had ran into a door and
bruised Youth A’s left hip. Youth A showed the bruise (a little
above her left hip) to Staff 4 while they were in the kitchen area.
Staff 4 reported Youth A became angry at Staff 1 on the day of the
alleged incident because Staff 1 didn’t take time to stop and speak
with Youth A. Staff 1 was leaving work and Youth A wanted to talk
about Staff 1’s son because Youth A likes Staff 1’s son. Staff 4
reported Staff 1 didn’t want to talk with Youth A about Staff 1’s son
and may have left quickly to “defuse” the situation of Youth A
6

liking Staff 1’s son. Staff 4 reported Youth A became hysterical
and mad when Youth B laughed at Youth A over Youth A’s
reaction.
Documents Reviewed:

Person Centered Safety Plan for Youth A dated 8/3/25. This

7

Let’s Talk About It Girls Home 3 Discipline Policy dated
2/2025. This document outlines the disciplinary approach to be
used at the facility:
Purpose: This policy outlines the disciplinary approach used at
Let's Talk About It (LTAI), a licensed child caring institution (CCI),
in accordance with the Michigan’s Licensing Rule R 400.4158.
The purpose of this policy is to ensure that all disciplinary actions
are trauma-informed, developmentally appropriate, and consistent
with youth rights, safety, and well-being. At LTAI. all responses to
behavior are designed to be respectful, restorative, and supportive
of the youth’s growth and healing. LTAI believes that discipline
should teach and reinforce positive behaviors, not punish or
shame.
Acceptable Discipline Practices:
Use of positive reinforcement and encouragement to promote
desired behaviors.
Natural and logical consequences that are directly related to the
youth’s behavior.
Use of verbal prompts, redirection, and de-escalation strategies.
Implementation of individual behavior support plans when
appropriate.
Conflict resolution and restorative practices.
Time away (sensory room, 2nd floor space, or porch) in a
supportive space for emotional regulation, when needed.
Prohibited Practices: The following disciplinary practices are
strictly prohibited at LTAI in accordance with licensing rule R
400.4158:
Corporal punishment inflicted in any matter (including hitting,
spanking, slapping, or shaking).
Denial of any essential program services.
Cruel, severe, or humiliating actions.
Verbal abuse, including yelling, threats, name-calling, or
derogatory remarks.
Deprivation of basic needs such as shelter, food, mail, clothing,
sleep, or bathroom access.
Denial of visits or communication with family or other supports.
Assigning unduly strenuous or demeaning work.
Isolation or seclusion in locked or non-therapeutic settings.
8

Use of mechanical or chemical restraints.
Group discipline, where consequences are applied to more than
one youth based on one individual’s behavior.
Residents shall not discipline other residents.
Staff Training and Expectations:
All staff receive ongoing training in trauma-informed care, de-
escalation, positive behavior supports, and Handle With Care.
Staff are expected to model respectful communication and
behavior.
Staff must document all incidents involving significant behavior,
consequences, or interventions.
After Visit Summary Family Health Center for Youth A dated
7/23/25. This document is the annual Well-Child review and
indicates Youth A is in good health and needs to return for a Well-
Child review in one year.
Incident/Investigation Report Kalamazoo Department of
Public Safety Case Number 25-009857 Dated 8/11/25. Youth A
is documented as alleging Staff 1 had hit Youth A leaving a pinch
shaped bruise on Youth A’s side. Youth A also alleged hearing
Staff 1 swearing at another youth (Youth B). This document
outlines Youth A’s ex-boyfriends statement. The ex-boyfriend
stated Youth A is known to make false reports and believes Youth
A injured herself rather than being hit by Staff 1. Staff 1 was
interviewed and denied hitting or swearing at a youth as alleged.
HR file for Staff 1 was reviewed, and she was hired to work at
the facility on 2/6/25. There is no disciplinary action documented
in the file and she is up to date on required trainings.
Video Review:
The video footage of the day of the incident (Saturday August
2, 2025, 1:00 pm to 3:20 pm) was reviewed. This involved three
different camera views (bedroom hallway, front stairway, and
dining room) which captured all movement in each of the areas
under surveillance. This three-camera view also allowed for
review of Youth A’s bedroom door and areas that Youth A and
Staff 1 were in during the time frame of the alleged incident. At
approximately 2:53 pm, Youth A is observed going into her
bedroom from the bathroom and at approximately 2:54 pm, Staff 1
is observed coming up the front stairs and going into Youth A’s
bedroom. Approximately 13 seconds later, Staff 1 is observed
coming out of Youth A’s bedroom and going back down the front
9

stairs. The camera view of the dining room footage shows Staff 1
returning to the dining room and placing a bottle (body oil) on the
table for Youth C. At approximately 3:01, Youth A is observed
coming down the front stairs and going into the dining room. Youth
A stands next to Staff 1and Staff 1 is observed fixing the back of
Youth A’s dress.
Walk-through:
A walk-through of this facility was conducted. This is an older 3-
story structure of which the youth have access to the first two
floors. Although the structure is older, it is maintained and all
necessary items such as plumbing are in working order. Each
room is furnished appropriately, and the temperature is kept at a
normal level. There is an appropriate amount of food (frozen,
fresh, and dry) available for the youth.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as evidenced by interviews with
staff, youth, documents and video recording. Evidence does not
support the allegations that Staff 1 hit Youth A. Evidence does
support that this is a patterned behavior (statements by Guardian
and ex-boyfriend) for Youth A and may be her way of trying to
avoid consequences of her choice to go AWOL and use a
substance by reflecting the issue to Staff 1. Supporting the
compliance findings; Youth A showed Staff 4 and Youth B a bruise
on Youth A’s left hip a few days prior to the allegations.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered regarding requesting more than
90-days of information on each youth requesting placement in the
facility. If the facility is going to provide appropriate care, they
need to know what issues (in this case significant substance
abuse) the youth are having throughout their lives.
Technical assistance was offered regarding staff entering a
youth’s bedroom and being off camera. Because of the significant
mental and emotional issues youth are presenting, staff must take
every safeguard to protect themselves and the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of

10

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A reported Staff 1 was swearing at Youth B in Walmart.
Investigation Administrator 1, Administrator 2, and Administrator 3 were

11

12

it was a quick response by Staff 1 because of what Youth B said.

Youth C was interviewed on 8/5/25 by MDHHS Worker 1 at the
facility and the following is the note from that interview.
Youth C came into the room and was upset and had to be talked
down by staff. Youth C was upset that other youth were laughing

Staff 4 was interviewed via phone with MDHHS Worker 1 on
8/13/2025. Regarding the situation at Walmart, Staff 4 reported
being present and the incident began with Staff 4. Staff 4 reported
this started when Staff 4 and Staff 2 were in a conversation and
Youth B got involved. Staff 4 informed Youth B the conversation
was not open to Youth B and Youth B needed to stop being
disrespectful. Youth B “blew up” and began threatening staff and
walked away from the group. Staff 4 reported walking away with
Youth A to de-escalate the situation. Staff 4 reported Youth A told
Staff 4 that Staff 1 said something inappropriate to Youth B, but
Youth B said Staff 1 didn’t threaten Youth B. Staff 4 never heard
Staff 1 say anything inappropriate to Youth B.
Documents Reviewed:
MDHHS interview with Youth A prior to this special
investigation initiation dated 8/5/25 and authored by MDHHS
Worker 2. Youth A stated that yesterday, they went to Walmart
and when asked, noted that it was two workers and three other
youth present. Youth A reported while at Walmart, two youth were
arguing and that a staff member, whom she identified as Staff 1
told Youth B to "shut up" and called her a "bald headed ass hoe."
Youth A stated Staff 1 also told Youth B that she would have her
niece come and "beat her ass."
13

Let’s Talk About It Girls Home 3 Discipline Policy dated
2/2025. This document outlines the disciplinary approach to be
used at the facility:
Acceptable Discipline Practices:
Use of positive reinforcement and encouragement to promote
desired behaviors.
Natural and logical consequences that are directly related to the
youth’s behavior.
Use of verbal prompts, redirection, and de-escalation strategies.
Implementation of individual behavior support plans when
appropriate.
Conflict resolution and restorative practices.
Time away (sensory room, 2nd floor space, or porch) in a
supportive space for emotional regulation, when needed.
Prohibited Practices: The following disciplinary practices are
strictly prohibited at LTAI in accordance with licensing rule R
400.4158:
Corporal punishment inflicted in any matter (including hitting,
spanking, slapping, or shaking).
Denial of any essential program services.
Cruel, severe, or humiliating actions.
Verbal abuse, including yelling, threats, name-calling, or
derogatory remarks.
Deprivation of basic needs such as shelter, food, mail, clothing,
sleep, or bathroom access.
Denial of visits or communication with family or other supports.
Assigning unduly strenuous or demeaning work.
Isolation or seclusion in locked or non-therapeutic settings.
Use of mechanical or chemical restraints.
Group discipline, where consequences are applied to more than
one youth based on one individual’s behavior.
Residents shall not discipline other residents.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as evidenced by interviews with
staff, youth, documents and video recording. Evidence does not
support the allegations that Staff 1 cursed at Youth B while at
Walmart. Evidence based on the report of three staff (Staff 1, Staff
2, and Staff 4 along with Youth C all confirm Staff 1 remained
professional and didn’t engage in derogatory remarks to Youth B.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered regarding the intake process the
facility is using to screen youth into the program. The facility
should insist on obtaining a complete background on youth to be
prepared to deal with any significant issues such as substance
14

abuse (presented by Youth A), as this can lead to further trauma
to the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
